name: West African Peanut Soup
author: DRUMNWRITE
summary: Tomatoes and peanut butter? YES! The first time I tried this at a health food restaurant, I was hooked. About 5 years of tweaking the recipe to my personal taste has created a spicy, sweet favorite amongst my friends and family. Luckily there is always enough for everyone!
ingredients: 2 large bell peppers, (any color) finely chopped
1 (28 ounce) can chopped tomatoes with juice
directions: Heat olive oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat
Cook onion, bell pepper, and garlic until lightly browned, about 5 minutes
Stir in tomatoes with their juice, vegetable broth, pepper, and red pepper flakes
Add rice to soup and stir
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 25 minutes, or until rice is tender
When rice is cooked, whisk in peanut butter and return to a simmer, and serve
Garnish with chopped roasted peanuts, if desired
